title: ASX closes 1.3pc higher; Afterpay takes 7.2pc hammering
text:
Lucas Baird

The S &P/ASX 200 Index has closed the trading session up 84.5 points, or 1.3 per cent, to 6736.5 points, with investors taking the benchmark to its third straight day of gains.

Gold miner Silver Lake Resources was the main boost to the index as share prices shot up 8.3 per cent to 98¢. However, the British-focused CYBG, a National Australia Bank spin-off, was also boosted up by 7.2 per cent to $2.52.

Technology play Nearmap advanced 7.1 per cent to $2.87 and Cooper Energy grew 7 per cent to 62¢.

On the other side of the ledger was Afterpay Touch, which was battered after UBS initiated its coverage of the stock with a "sell" recommendation and a target price that more than halved the company's market value. Overall, the stock shed 7.2 per cent to $33.92.

Radio broadcaster Southern Cross Media fell 6.4 per cent to 88¢ and Pilbara Minerals was down 4.8 per cent to be worth 30¢ a share.
description: Westpac: Economic growth now materially below trend; UBS rates Afterpay 'sell', halves its target price; RBNZ prepared for unconventional monetary policy.
